choices: a. The 'recursive_harmonic()' takes the same memory space as the 'not_recursive_harmonic()' method.
b. There are situations when iteration (loop) is the only option rather than recursion that is avalibable to address a problem.
c. Any recursive function can be replaced by an iterative counterpart.
d. System keeps track of each recursive call in Java using a data structure called stack.
